title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Runs on battery not on charger only. Haven't been able to figure out what is going on with the charger circuit. Thought I had it but it died after booting up. NOw it seems it is shutting the charger off quicker. Tried changing dcin board. CHecked sys_onewire for continuity.

replaced iSL a few times checked resitors around it had a high 20 ohm resistor at r7021 and replaced it and caps around it thinking it was related to adapter sense at first. replaced q7080. reflowed smc being at times I had smc bc acok. Doesn't seem I can get voltage off charger long enough to get consistent readings off of ISL.

Not detecting a short on ppbus g3h ~.43V drop red probe to ground

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: Post basic voltahes for U7000 w/ charger only; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: its shutting the charger off too fast for me to get anything consistent around the ISL. my 3.42V and 16.5V is there for usually just a second. SOmetimes green light and fan spin but lately not getting that. Im not detecting short on ppbus g3h =.441V drop or 3.42V lines .358 voltage drop.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
got some where. I was unsure placement of q7080 and went to adjust it and it broke. replaced that and now getting mostly consistent around u7000:

1-0
2-15V
3-3.95V
9-0
12-3.48V
13-3.48V
14-3.32V
15-0
17-1.7-1.8V pulsing!
19-5V
20-5V
27-1.7V-1.8V pulsing... 

does the matching/pulsing 17 & 27 voltage imply u5420 issue? I know thats a problem but not sure what it means.
resistance:

17/18=2.7ohm
27/28=20.3ohm

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: ppbus_g3h is 1.7V

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
"1-0
-----------
27-1.7V-1.8V pulsing"
Looks like a problem with Q7080; did you solder new one?

Post exact resistance value for R7080/81 and R7085/86; measured onboard, ohm scale.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
took q7080 from other board. I think 2nd one I tried but wondering if soldered good. is there good way to test if soldered well? I tested to make sure I didn't have continutiy between smaller pads where possible.

7080- 99.3K ohm
81- 61.8k ohm
85- 444K ohm
86- 327k ohm

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: resoldered q7080. pulsing stopped but pin 17 is still 1.7V and pin 27 is still 1.7V. I'll try replacing q7080 again.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Stop replacing Q7080, if you get correct voltage at R7020.
Replace C7025, and Q7030/35.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
measure at r7020 is 1.096V.
replaced c7025, q7030/5 
no change

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Probably bad solders at Q7080, or bad MOSFET.
With 0V at pin 1/U7000, you MUST get normal voltage at R7020.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: changed them all a couple times keep getting 1V at R7020!!! damn

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Remove Q7080 and check continuity from its pads to other components.
Pay atention to Gate pads, go through holes on the other side.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: Just got back to this one. You were right! I apparently didn't have a good solder job on Q7080. Being I'm new, I didn't realize importance of using good solder and have suffered some from thinking I had good solder joints and such, being this was from a bit ago, I think it was related to that. I now have 12.26V on PPBUS_G3H so looking at the SMC...

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: exactly 3.48V on both SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA/SCL. Heating SMC brought PPBUS_G3H to 12.48V. See slight tick on fan spin when putting to power. So assuming SMC isn't boosting to 12.65V? I'll reheat one more time and then replace if I can... not sure I have template for this SMC?

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
You should reball it first.
Direct heat stencil and solder paste is the easiest way.

Not too many balls, can be placed at hand too.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
tried twice with same replacement chip and got 12.3V still. Try another? or...?
2nd round attempt feeling pretty good about the placement and contacts. First try I reheated after setting and gave it a bit too big of a tap! but also had 12.25V prior and after.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: Post voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus now.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
3.48V at SCL/SDA both.
diode SDA .524V | SCL .509V
Too big of a difference?

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Looks too big difference.
Did you test the board alone, no battery, nor BIL connected?
Remove D6950 and check again, when board gets cold.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: I did check out of case with nothing else connected. will do.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
NOw .522V SDA & .505 SCL 
R5280/1 are both exactly 1.97K ohms

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Try removing each component connected on these lines.
Remove ISL6259 before SMC; let it at the end.
C6952/53 and even corrosion under J6950/55 is possible.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Went throuth those one by one and was always about .18V difference SCL/SDA voltage drop.
Had to replace SMC again. Solved the SCA/SDL issue. 12.62V PPBUS. No Fan spin.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Power rails I've checked. I don't have much experience checking through power rails but referred to prior case where it applied:

S5_PWRGD is 3.4V


PM_SLP_S4_L is 0V


3V3_S5 =3.3V


SMC Adapter EN= 3.4V


PM_BATLOW _L= 0V


PM_DSW_PWRGD,= 0v


PCH_DSWVRMEN,= 3.24V


PM_RSMRST_L, = 0V


PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.4V

SMC came from another 2915 board and using 85W charger.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
PM_BATLOW _L shoulf be high with 85W charger.
Check power charger reported in System Report from working machine.

Check if your board starts with both charger and battery connected.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message: working machine recognizes charger as 85W. No start with battery and charger connected.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
" S5_PWRGD is 3.4V
----------------------
PM_DSW_PWRGD,= 0v "
This could be SMC issue; check the Apple note ftom page 72.
Even PCH can pull down this signal; if has an internal damage.
Check all RTC signals at page 16.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Reballed and did SMC again
SDL/SCA lines still good.
PM BATLOW L is still 0
PM DSW PWRGD still 0

SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC = .4V
RTC_RESET L = 3.47V
PCH SRTCRST L = 3.47
PCH INTRUDER L = 3V
PCH INTVRMEN L = 3.35V

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
If S5_PWRGD is high, SMC MUST release PM_DS_PWRGD signal; did you read the note???

Try another SMC.

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
YEs I read the note but wasn't sure if the RTC readings you requested were relevant to a bad PCH. I don't understand how the RTC signals are related to the diagnosing or if they would infer a damaged PCH as you also mentioned.

I'll try another SMC!

title: 820-2915 reset charger and green light and fan spin but shutting charger off
message:
Old boards have 4 RTC DC signals for PCH.
PCH can start power on sequence without RTC clock, but NOT if one of the other 4 DC signals is not correct.
Nothe that, new PCH generations do not require PCH_INTVRMEN, nor PCH_INTRUDER_L signals.
